sources.title: AI Transcription Accuracy: A 2025 Comparison of Top Services
sources.snippet: As you can see, while no AI can yet match the consistent 99%+ accuracy of a professional human transcriber in all conditions, the top services are getting remarkably close, especially with high-quality audio. For many use cases, the combination of speed, cost, and high accuracy makes AI transcription an incredibly powerful tool. One such tool making waves is Umevo.ai, which leverages advanced ...

citation_mappings.claim_text: AI tools can hit ~90-95%+ accuracy on good audio. Expect more errors with noise or accents. UMEVO

üß† Notes on Accuracy AI alone won‚Äôt consistently match human transcription in difficult conditions (overlapping speakers, heavy accents, background noise). Human + AI or professional human services give ~99% where it matters. HappyScribe

sources.title: Researchers say an AI-powered transcription tool used in hospitals invents things no one ever said
sources.snippet:
A growing concern is emerging over OpenAI's AI-powered transcription tool, Whisper, which is being used widely across industries including healthcare. Despite being praised for near-human level accuracy, experts have found that Whisper frequently introduces false or fabricated text, known as "hallucinations." These hallucinations can include imagined treatments, racial references, and violent statements‚Äîeven in clear, short audio clips. Researchers have found hallucinations in up to 80% of transcripts studied, raising alarm about its use in sensitive fields like medicine.

Whisper is already integrated into systems run by companies like Microsoft and Oracle and is used by over 30,000 clinicians through a Whisper-based medical tool developed by Nabla. Critics, including former OpenAI employees and academic researchers, warn that these errors can be dangerous in high-risk domains such as healthcare, especially since some hospitals erase original audio, removing a reference point for verification. OpenAI acknowledges the flaw and says it is working on improvements but advises against using Whisper in critical decision-making contexts. Lawmakers and patient advocates express additional concern over privacy issues tied to the use of sensitive audio by large tech platforms.

citation_mappings.claim_text: Some AI engines (like older Whisper-based tools) have been documented to hallucinate text that wasn‚Äôt said, especially in sensitive or noisy real-world recordings ‚Äî meaning tools matter. AP News
